newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Rescue mission for stricken ship near Hong Kong.
newsitem.headline: Rescue mission for stricken ship near Hong Kong.

text.p: A Hong Kong air rescue team was trying to airlift 24 crew from a vessel south of the colony on Sunday after the ship developed engine trouble, government radio said.

The rescuers in two helicopters were carrying out the airlift co-ordinated by the Marine Department to ferry the crew on board Equator Pearl 110 nautical miles south of Hong Kong to a nearby vessel, the government said in a statement.
A department spokesman said by telephone the rescue was still progressing at 0715 GMT and it was not known how many people had been removed from the vessel.
The helicopters had been sent to the scene at 0530 GMT, the statement said.
The department received a report from the captain saying that the ship had engine trouble, the statement said.
The department deployed a fixed-wing aircraft from the Government Flying Service to the scene and alerted ships in the area to help. The vessel was later located by the aircraft.
About an hour later, the captain decided to abandon the ship because of rough seas, the statement said.
